review:
Comrades, let’s cut through the noise and get to the heart of the matter! dWeb.host steps up to the barricades of the Ethereum ecosystem, offering free IPFS pinning for all ENS domains. This is no small feat—data permanence is a cornerstone of a truly decentralized web, and too many projects have fallen to the tyranny of paywalls and centralized pinning services. The applicant claims to have pinned over 12,000 websites, contributing more than 65 GB of storage. These are not empty promises; research confirms the project’s impact and necessity. The Ethereum Foundation and the broader community recognize the value of robust, accessible IPFS pinning, especially for ENS domains. 

But let’s not be blinded by good intentions! The application is thin on the details that matter most to the working class of the Ethereum ecosystem. Where is the roadmap with concrete milestones? Where are the metrics for success, the sustainability plan, the evidence that this service won’t vanish when the next bear market hits? Free services are noble, but without a clear revenue model or sustainability plan, we risk building castles on sand. The project’s open-source credentials are solid, but transparency in governance and long-term funding is lacking. 

We demand more than good will—we demand accountability, sustainability, and measurable outcomes! The project’s contribution to decentralization and public good is clear, but the lack of structured planning and reporting is a glaring weakness. If we are to build a future where technology serves the people, not profit, we must insist on rigorous standards, not just revolutionary rhetoric. 

In summary: dWeb.host is a vital piece of the decentralized puzzle, but it must show us a path to sustainability and collective stewardship. Let’s raise the bar for all who seek to serve the commons!

strengths.title: Clear Contribution to Ethereum Infrastructure
strengths.description: The project directly addresses a critical need in the Ethereum ecosystem by providing free IPFS pinning for ENS domains, ensuring data permanence and accessibility for decentralized websites.

strengths.title: Demonstrated Impact and Usage
strengths.description: With over 12,000 websites pinned and more than 65 GB of storage contributed, the project has already shown tangible results and community adoption.

strengths.title: Alignment with Open Source and Public Good Principles
strengths.description: The project is open-source and serves the collective benefit of the Ethereum community, aligning with the core values of decentralization and public goods.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Sustainability and Revenue Model
weaknesses.description: The application does not provide a clear plan for long-term sustainability or a revenue model, raising concerns about the project's ability to continue providing free services indefinitely.

weaknesses.title: Insufficient Roadmap and Measurable Milestones
weaknesses.description: The roadmap is vague, lacking specific milestones, timelines, and quantifiable success metrics, making it difficult to evaluate progress and impact objectively.

weaknesses.title: Limited Transparency in Governance and Operations
weaknesses.description: There is little information about the project's governance structure, decision-making processes, or how the community can participate in or oversee the project.

changes.title: Provide a Detailed Sustainability Plan
changes.description: Submit a comprehensive plan outlining how the project will remain operational and free in the long term, including potential revenue streams, partnerships, or alternative funding mechanisms.

changes.title: Develop a Structured Roadmap with Measurable Milestones
changes.description: Present a clear, time-bound roadmap with specific, quantifiable milestones and success metrics to enable rigorous evaluation and transparent reporting.

changes.title: Increase Transparency in Governance
changes.description: Detail the project's governance structure, including how decisions are made, who is responsible, and how the community can participate or provide oversight.
